meanings.definition: To educate or train again, especially in a different way or setting.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a new country, she had to be reschooled in their language.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reschooled the students on proper lab safety procedures.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to need to be reschooled on how to catch a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, ready to be reschooled with new information.
meanings.sent5: The old building was reschooled with modern technology, becoming a smart home.

meanings.definition: To provide new knowledge or skills to someone who has already been educated.
meanings.sent1: The workshop aimed to reschool professionals in the latest marketing techniques.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reschool herself in computer programming to advance her career.
meanings.sent3: The magician reschooled his assistant on the art of misdirection.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was reschooled in the ways of love after meeting him.
meanings.sent5: The old dog was reschooled in obedience, learning new tricks with ease.
